Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Underbelly \Un"der*bel`ly\, n. 1. The lower ventral part of the abdomen of an animal, especially one that walks on four feet. [PJC]
2. The surface of an object closest to the ground, especially of an extended object such as an airplane. [PJC]
3. The weak point of an object vulnerable to attack; used especially in the phrase ``the soft underbelly''. [PJC]

underbelly n 1: lower side; "the underbellies of clouds" 2: the soft belly or underside of an animal's body [syn: {underbody}] 3: the quality of being weak or unprotected; "the soft underbelly of the Axis"- Winston Churchill
